I have seen enemy clerics raise the undead.  I have seen enemy druids 
use the spell of protection and summon faeries in my own scenarios.  
The only character I think that is severly deficient in its 
programming are slime.

I had my entire team (1 mega powered archmage) mind controlled once 
and it lasted after the offending archmage was dead.  My team has been 
effected by enemy chain lightning in one of the original scenarios.  I 
have seen enemy mages freeze time REPEATEDLY in a certain one of the 
tevfifty and one of my own scenarios has been accused of fostering 
mages that repeatedly freeze time.

Admittedly, I have not seen enemy archmages summon images or fire 
elementals.  However, those would be extremely to prove an enemy 
archmage would do so unless one created a scenario with 100% named 
characters and no monster generators.

I have no my problems with any other mega powered characters except 
faeries.  But faeries, ghosts, and sketelons are not likely to be 
around much once I complete this set and if you go through certain 
scenarios, you should understand my concern about facing faeries and 
ghosts.

Well, in most of my scenarios, there will be no NPCs.  But, if I do 
have an NPC in my scenarios, the NPC will be sufficient to help you 
out in some problems. 

However, one slight note:  I have designed a scenario where a team 
composed entirely of clerics can NOT win [unless you are extremely 
lucky] and that scenario is on the main path.

Yes, I do realize some of my scenarios are not well suited for 
archers, but neither are certain ones of the tevfifty.

I need opinions from more people on this subject of experience level 
15 and higher mages and archmages.
